```{r}
# Join all data frames in list
list_hospitals = list(dshs_dir_19,dshs_E_19,dshs_I_19)

# Join multiple dataframes
combined_hospital_data <- list_hospitals %>% 
  reduce(inner_join, by='FID')

```


```{r}
# Filter for hospitals we want to compare
hospital_data_19 <- combined_hospital_data %>% 
  filter(FID %in% c(293105, 1130950, 1411240, 2015024))

```


```{r}

# Convert financial variables to numeric
transform(hospital_data_19, E3M1 = as.numeric(E3M1))
transform(hospital_data_19, E4C1 = as.numeric(E4C1))
transform(hospital_data_19, E3C1 = as.numeric(E3C1))
transform(hospital_data_19, E5A1 = as.numeric(E5A1))
transform(hospital_data_19, E5B1 = as.numeric(E5B1))
transform(hospital_data_19, I2C = as.numeric(I2C))

# Calculate cost-to-charge-ratio and assign to new variable
hospital_data_19$ctc_ratio <- 
  hospital_data_19$E3M1 / (hospital_data_19$E4C1 + hospital_data_19$E3C1)

# Calculate charity care charges (bad debt + financial aid) and assign to new variable
hospital_data_19$charity_charges_bf <- 
  hospital_data_19$E5A1 + hospital_data_19$E5B1

# Calculate charity care costs (cost-to-charge-ratio * (bad debt + financial assistance)) and assign to new variable
hospital_data_19$charity_costs_bf <- 
  hospital_data_19$charity_charges_bf * hospital_data_19$ctc_ratio

# Calculate alternative measure of charity costs (cost-to-charge-ratio * financial assistance) and assign to new variable
hospital_data_19$charity_costs_f <- 
  hospital_data_19$E5B1 * hospital_data_19$ctc_ratio

# Calculate another alternative measure of charity costs (cost-to-charge-ratio * I2C)
hospital_data_19$charity_costs_i <- 
  hospital_data_19$I2C * hospital_data_19$ctc_ratio

```


```{r}
# Rename column names
hospital_data_19 <- hospital_data_19 %>% rename(
  "Other_Operating_Revenue" = E3C1,
  "Total_Expenses_less_bad_debt" = E3M1,
  "Total_Gross_Inpatient_Revenue"  = E4A1,
  "Total_Gross_Outpatien_Revenue" = E4B1,
  "Total_Gross_Patient_Revenue" = E4C1,
  "Bad_Debt" = E5A1,
  "Financial_Assistance" = E5B1,
  "Charity_Charges_I2C" = I2C)

```


```{r}
# Subset data to only keep variables we need
hospital_data_19_subset <- hospital_data_19 %>% 
  select(YEAR,
         FID,
         FACILITY,
         COUNTY, 
         STATE,
         Other_Operating_Revenue,
         Total_Expenses_less_bad_debt,
         Total_Gross_Inpatient_Revenue,
         Total_Gross_Outpatien_Revenue,
         Total_Gross_Patient_Revenue,
         Bad_Debt, 
         Financial_Assistance,
         ctc_ratio, 
         Charity_Charges_I2C,
         charity_charges_bf, 
         charity_costs_bf,
         charity_costs_f,
         charity_costs_i)


# Print the first few rows of the new data frame
head(hospital_data_19_subset)


```
